page.title: 12CHANGING TIMES, TORTHORWALD
page.content: {School 1915_85 There used to have a wall up the middle of the playground to separate the boys and girls. Now we play together. Where our football pitch is now, it used to be a huge garden. They had very little sports then, but we have sports all the year round. They used to have two coal fires. Now we have storage heaters in each room. The toilets used to be outside. Ours are inside. We have no prize giving now. There were no school dinners then, but we get a two course meal daily for 55p. {Clothes 1915_85 Children went to school with shorts and clogs. They had bare feet in summer.
